title.narrative: Mechanism 17947 - Implementation of Sustainable Laboratory Quality Systems

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
For the FY 2016, AMREF Kenya will utilize a budget of $700,000 to help Kenya in the specified counties (Kilifi, Kwale, Mombasa, Kitui, Makueni, Machakos counties) in the following areas: Support the counties in addressing gaps related to laboratory program coordination at county levels; Advocacy for county resource allocation for laboratory work; implementation of medical laboratory policy guide Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.3: Biomedical Prevention - Blood Safety. Activities supporting a nationally-coordinated blood program to ensure a safe and adequate blood supply including: infrastructure and policies; donor recruitment activities, blood collection, testing for transfusion-transmissible infections, component preparation, storage and distribution; appropriate clinical use of blood, transfusion procedures and hemovigilance; training and human resource development; monitoring and evaluation; and development of sustainable systems. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.4: Biomedical Prevention - Injection Safety. Policies, training, waste-management systems, advocacy and other activities to promote medical injection safety, including distribution/supply chain, cost and appropriate disposal of injection equipment and other related equipment and supplies. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. objectives

For the FY 2016, AMREF Kenya will utilize a budget of $700,000 to help Kenya in the specified counties (Kilifi, Kwale, Mombasa, Kitui, Makueni, Machakos counties) in the following areas: Support the counties in addressing gaps related to laboratory program coordination at county levels; Advocacy for county resource allocation for laboratory work; implementation of medical laboratory policy guidelines by County Health Management Teams (CHMTs) and Health Facilities (HFs); Support LIMs flow of laboratory data and online reporting of rapid test kits and other commodities including other reportable indicators; training and equipment support for laboratory biosafety and medical waste management; support laboratories on IQC, proficiency testing and external quality assessment (EQA); Support implementation and enrollment of 21 laboratories into QMS program (SLMTA/SLIPTA); support sample networking for CD4, early infant diagnosis, viral load, and sputum; Support the counties in laboratory equipment maintenance and point of care testing (POCT) thus improving case detection and management of HIV/TB patients due to increased POCT usage and support monitoring and evaluation (M&E). These efforts will lead to improved patient-centered quality laboratory services and will lead to sustainable quality, timeliness and reliability of laboratory results.

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
